prop.head.headtext: Thorburn, Law of Confidential Business Information

prop.head.label.name: Chapter
prop.head.headtext: Claims for Breach of Confidential Business Information

para.paratext: Most of the cases dealing with breach of express or implied contractual obligations regarding the use of confidential business information arise in the employment context. With the increasing importance of knowledge as a source of power and wealth, the information acquired by employees and management personnel and the restrictions on their ability to disseminate that information have become increasingly important. The courts will enforce any express or implied obligations of a contracting party provided the clause in question is reasonable and lawful. The courts have dealt with two types of clauses protecting confidential business information: non-competition clauses restricting the mobility of employees and thus their use of acquired business knowledge, and clauses relating specifically to the protection of the information.
